v.v: These are the words of the Teacher, the descendant of David and king in Jerusalem.
What profit does mankind gain from all the work that they labor at under the sun?
All the rivers flow into the sea,
Whatever has been is what will be,
Is there anything about which it may be said,
No one seems to remember the things that happened in ancient times,
I am the Teacher, and I have been king over Israel in Jerusalem.
I applied my mind to study and to search out by wisdom everything that is done under heaven. That search is a burdensome task that God has given to the children of mankind to be busy with.
I have seen all the deeds that are done under the sun, and look, they all amount to vapor and chasing the wind.
I have spoken to my heart saying, “Look, I have acquired greater wisdom than all who were before me in Jerusalem. My mind has seen great wisdom and knowledge.”
So I applied my heart to know wisdom and also madness and folly. I came to understand that this also was an attempt to shepherd the wind.
For in the abundance of wisdom there is much frustration, and he who increases knowledge increases sorrow.

v: “Like a vapor of mist,
like a breeze in the wind,
everything vanishes, leaving many questions.
and another generation comes,
but the earth remains forever.
and it goes down
and hurries back to the place where it rises again.
and circles around to the north,
always going around along its pathway
and coming back again.
but the sea is never full.
To the place where the rivers go,
there they go again.
and no one can explain it.
The eye is not satisfied by what it sees,
nor is the ear fulfilled by what it hears.
and whatever has been done is what will be done.
There is nothing new under the sun.
‘Look, this is new’?
Whatever exists has already existed for a long time,
during ages which came long before us.
and the things that happened much later
and that will happen in the future
will not likely be remembered either.”
The missing cannot be counted!
